subject: Career
title: Loss Aversion and Career Inertia
description: One-minute skill: Loss Aversion and Career Inertia.

hook.text: You're unhappy but safe. The new path excites you but terrifies you. Loss aversion wins.

buildup.text: Kahneman showed: the pain of losing what you have outweighs the joy of gaining something better.

discovery.text: In career terms: sunk cost (years invested), status loss, and financial risk keep people stuck.

twist.text: The 'sunk cost fallacy' says: 'I've invested too much to leave.' But past investment can't be recovered either way.

climax.text: Ask: 'If I were starting today with no history, would I choose this path?' If no, the sunk cost is irrelevant.

punchline.text: The years you've spent don't obligate the years ahead.

quiz.question: What is the sunk cost fallacy in career decisions?
options: Staying because you've already invested years, even if it's wrong
